note: Target audience personas for TamperTantrum Labs. These represent the developers and teams we serve.

personas.name: Sam Chen
personas.title: Indie App Dev
personality_and_values: Values fast feedback and clear takeaways
Cares about UX and clean code
goals: Launch secure SaaS apps with minimal tech debt
Automate security checks in GitHub Actions
Build user trust before monetization
pain_points: Doesn't know what security he's missing
Overwhelmed by security tools and jargon
Wants to use things like Semgrep but doesn't know where to start
Can't afford traditional consultants

personas.name: Sara Malik
personas.title: Startup CTO
personality_and_values: Wants security without friction for her devs
goals: Prep for SOC 2 / compliance milestones
Harden auth flows, APIs, and CI/CD pipelines
Impress investors with AppSec maturity
pain_points: No internal AppSec lead yet
Devs see security as blockers
Concerned about 'unknown unknowns' in the stack

personas.name: Ben Okafor
personas.title: Open Source Maintainer
goals: Make the project safer for contributors
Automate checks on pull requests
Set a security standard for their community
pain_points: Doesn't know which policies or tools to adopt
No budget for external AppSec help
Nervous about handling user data responsibly

personas.name: Paige Rios
personas.title: Freelance Dev Team Lead
personality_and_values: Wants to add security as a 'bonus feature'
Appreciates expert guidance she can trust
goals: Deliver secure apps that boost client trust
Use security as a value-add in proposals
Learn enough to confidently implement safe defaults
pain_points: Doesn't know how to 'sell' security to clients
Worried about breaking things with changes
Needs just-in-time help, not full-time support

personas.name: Victor Reyes
personas.title: Founder / Product Manager
personality_and_values: Values ROI, speed, and user trust
goals: Launch secure MVPs fast
'Check off' security for partners/investors
Get simple dashboards or summaries he can forward
pain_points: Doesn't speak dev fluently
Overwhelmed by AppSec acronyms
Needs to justify AppSec spend with real outcomes

personas.name: Casey Nguyen
personas.title: DevRel / Platform Engineer
personality_and_values: Loves improving DX and creating systems that scale
Advocates for good tooling, not top-down mandates
Big on open source and automation
goals: Standardize lightweight security across projects
Equip devs with tools that don't interrupt flow
Keep security out of Jira hell
pain_points: Devs ignore tools they don't trust
Doesn't have time to coach every team on AppSec
Needs GitHub-native, CI/CD-friendly solutions

personas.name: Chris Park
personas.title: Aspiring Security Learner
personality_and_values: Eager to learn and break into the field
goals: Build a strong AppSec portfolio
Learn to find & fix real-world vulnerabilities
Use beginner-friendly tooling with guided feedback
pain_points: Overwhelmed by complex tools (e.g. Burp, ZAP)
Doesn't know what 'real' AppSec workflows look like
Has limited budget and wants approachable on-ramps
